item.title: Broken Command
item.dc:creator: @uncalled_for uncalled for
item.description:
@uncalled_for wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:5, topic:552056”]Is the command within another if statement that checks for player rights?
Or is it within a method that is only accessed when you have a specific player rights?[/quote]

Within a method. When I remove the second argument from my code, it works fine, but obviously doesn’t do what I want… This is a real tricky one.

item.description:
@uncalled_for wrote:

It hasn’t worked before, but the ::item command is 95% similar to this. The only exception there is for this is to check if the user has has used two arguments so ::outitem 1
I really do not understand where I am going wrong, everything looks correct.

item.title: Broken Command
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“uncalled for, post:1, topic:552056”]Hello everybody.

I have a quick question, I am really confused as to why this command does not work. I have something similar to this which works correctly.

[code]if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“outitem”)) {

		String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
		int theItem = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);

		for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
			if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
				Client c2 = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[j];

				c2.sendMessage("[<col=255>Global</col>] <col=1461281>"
						+ c.playerName + " item name is:<shad> "
						+ c.getItems().getItemName(theItem)
						+ "</shad> !</col>");

			}
		}

	}[/code]

All this command is supposed to do is take the item id from the user as input, and convert that id to the item name, and send the name of that item to everyone.
However, my code does nothing. Can anybody spot this mistake?[/quote]

Did it work before? Is there some precondition that’s not being me? Are there any exceptions thrown?

Read full topic

item.title: Broken Command
item.dc:creator: @uncalled_for uncalled for
item.description:
@uncalled_for wrote:

Hello everybody.

I have a quick question, I am really confused as to why this command does not work. I have something similar to this which works correctly.

[code]if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase(“outitem”)) {

		String[] args = playerCommand.split(" ");
		int theItem = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);

		for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
			if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
				Client c2 = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[j];

				c2.sendMessage("[<col=255>Global</col>] <col=1461281>"
						+ c.playerName + " item name is:<shad> "
						+ c.getItems().getItemName(theItem)
						+ "</shad> !</col>");

			}
		}

	}[/code]

All this command is supposed to do is take the item id from the user as input, and convert that id to the item name, and send the name of that item to everyone.
However, my code does nothing. Can anybody spot this mistake?

Read full topic
